intro: Anthosachne australasica, commonly known as the Australian sedge, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. Its slender, grass-like leaves are arranged in a triangular cross-section, a characteristic feature of many sedges. Anthosachne australasica produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are often hidden among the foliage.
